channel.title: socalTECH.com
channel.itunes:subtitle: High Tech News and Information for Southern California
channel.itunes:author: Benjamin F. Kuo
channel.itunes:summary: socalTECH.com interviews entrepreneurs, high tech executives, and venture capitalists in Southern California, who are creating the next generation of high tech companies from Santa Barbara to San Diego.

item.title: Interview with Danny Kastner, FanRocket
item.description: Southern California is an interesting environment for both technology and media, and in particular for the fascinating intersections of the two industries. One of the most interesting projects in recent months that combines the two is "It's Your Show", an online, Internet project created by NBC's Carson Daly. It's Your Show rewards users who upload their own user-generated video content with prizes, and with eventual broadcast of the winners on a television show. For today's interview, socalTECH's Ben Kuo spoke with Danny Kastner, CEO of FanRocket (www.fanrocket.com), the firm that powered the technology behind the social networking and user generated content on It's Your Show, and got his perspective on how Hollywood is now starting to think about interactivity in conjunction with its programming.
item.author: info@socaltech.com
item.itunes:author: socalTECH
item.itunes:subtitle: Interview with Danny Kastner of FanRocket, the firm that powered the user generated content and social networking technology behind Carson Daly's It's Your Show.

item.itunes:keywords: social networking video television carson daly

item.title: Interview with Tony Greenberg, Ramprate
item.description: In the recent rush to the Internet with many online video and photo sharing sites, there's been an assumption that bandwidth is free and it costs nothing to provide these services. However, we recently spoke to Tony Greenberg, whose firm, Ramprate, helps companies like CBS,. iFilm, Yahoo, Sony, Virgin, and many others with IT hosting and content delivery costs. He details some of the costs of delivering Internet content for us.
item.author: info@socaltech.com
item.itunes:author: socalTECH
item.itunes:subtitle: Interview with Tony Greenberg, Ramprate, on the economics of content delivery
item.itunes:summary: In the recent rush to the Internet with many online video and photo sharing sites, there's been an assumption that bandwidth is free and it costs nothing to provide these services. However, we recently spoke to Tony Greenberg, whose firm, Ramprate, helps companies like CBS,. iFilm, Yahoo, Sony, Virgin, and many others with IT hosting and content delivery costs. He details some of the costs of delivering Internet content for us.
item.itunes:keywords: cdn, content delivery, hosting costs, rich media

item.title: Interview with Matthew Kazmierczak, AeA
item.description: Today, we're featuring a podcast interview with Matthew Kazmierczak, Vice President of Research and Industry Analysis at the AeA. The AeA recently released its CyberStates report, a report on the growth of high technology regions in the United States, and its California Cybercities report, which analyzed California's high tech industry. The Cybercities report included an interesting tidbit, showing that Southern California actually employs nearly as many people in high technology as Northern California does. We spoke to Matthew about the report and it's findings.
item.author: info@socaltech.com
item.itunes:author: socalTECH
item.itunes:subtitle: Interview with Matthew Kazmierczak, Vice President, Research and Industry Analysis, AeA, on its CyberStates report.

item.itunes:keywords: aea, technology, california, high tech, employment, jobs, startups

item.title: Interview with Kevin Perkins, Greenlight Wirelss
item.description: Our podcast today is with Kevin Perkins, CEO of Greenlight Wireless, a company that is developing mobile wireless products. The company is known for Skweezer, a service that takes any web page and reformats it for a mobile device. Kevin talks about Advertizer, a new service that Greenlight is offering in the advertising arena, and the business.
item.author: info@socaltech.com
item.itunes:author: socalTECH
item.itunes:subtitle: Interview with Kevin Perkins, CEO and co-founder of Greenlight Wireless, a firm that develops an online service and software for mobile web browsing

item.itunes:keywords: greenlight wireless mobile skweezer entrepreneur startup

item.title: Interview with Mike Jones, Userplane
item.description: For today's podcast, socalTECH spoke with Mike Jones, CEO and President of Userplane, a Los Angeles-based company that provides instant messaging and other applications for social networking web sites. Mike talks to socalTECH's Ben Kuo about his company's applications for social networking, customers like MySpace, and some of his company's plans in the IM federation space and possible venture funding,
item.author: info@socaltech.com
item.itunes:author: socalTECH
item.itunes:subtitle: Interview with Mike Jones, CEO and President of Userplane,

item.itunes:keywords: userplane, instant messaging, im, myspace, venture capital, vc

item.title: Interview with Robert Petrossian, Siderean Software
item.description:
Our podcast interview today is with Robert Petrossian, CEO of Siderean Software. Siderean is a venture-backed startup located in El Segundo that is tackling the corporate side of the search market. Robert talks to socalTECH's Ben Kuo about how the company fits into the search space, and how it compares with Google and other consumer search engines.
Robert Petrossian: My name is Robert Petrossian, and I'm the CEO of Siderean Software. Siderean Software provides software for information access to the enterprise. According to Moore's Law, the computing power is increasing, the interesting side effect of that is... (Continued)
item.author: info@socaltech.com
item.itunes:author: socalTECH
item.itunes:subtitle: Interview with Robert Petrossian, CEO of Siderean Software, a company in El Segundo providing search tools for the corporate market.

item.title: Interview with Leo Spiegel, Mission Ventures
item.description: Frank Peters, a guest podcaster for socalTECH, speaks to Leo Spiegel, a venture capitalist at Mission Ventures. Leo tells the story of Sandpiper Networks, the largest return from any Tech Coast Angel investment to date. He speaks of the transition from CEO/entrepreneur to venture capitalist.
item.author: info@socaltech.com
item.itunes:author: socalTECH
item.itunes:subtitle: Frank Peters interviews Leo Spiegel of Mission Ventures

item.itunes:keywords: mission, venture capital, vc, investment, sandpiper, entrepeneurship, startup

item.title: Interview with Jim Armstrong, Clearstone Venture Partners
item.description: I spoke with Jim Armstrong, who is Managing Director of Clearstone Venture Partners (www.clearstone.com) the other day, to get a sense of where they are investing nowadays, and for Jim's views on where the venture market is here in Southern California. Jim also talked to me about the whole idea of a venture capital ecosystem, and the challenges of the industry here in the area around experienced management.
item.author: info@socaltech.com
item.itunes:author: socalTECH
item.itunes:subtitle: Interview with Jim Armstrong, who is Managing Director of Clearstone Venture Partners in Santa Monica (Podcast)

item.itunes:keywords: clearstone, venture capital, investment, vc, california, startup, entrepreneur

item.title: Interview with Marc Diana, LeadPoint
item.description:
Our Friday podcast is with Marc Diana, founder and CEO of LeadPoint, a company in Los Angeles that is developing a marketplace for leads. We've interviewed Marc Diana in the past, but with these new podcasts we're trying to let our readers and listeners get to know our interview subjects better.
Marc Diana: I'm Marc Diana, CEO of LeadPoint, Leadpoint started coming up just over two years ago, and operates a lead exchange marketplace. We provide a pure environment where buyers/marketers of consumer prospects can meet and exchange data. What's a lead, to Leadpoint, a lead is...
item.author: info@socaltech.com
item.itunes:author: socalTECH
item.itunes:subtitle: Interview with Marc Diana, CEO and Founder of LeadPoint, a Los Angeles firm that provides an online mortgage lead marketplace.

item.title: Interview with Jim Mazzo, Advanced Medical Optics
item.description: Frank Peters interviews Jim Mazzo, CEO of Advanced Medical Optics. "Vision for Life" is the motto for Advanced Medical Optics, that's what we'll hear from CEO Jim Mazzo. AMO is a spin-off from Allergan with a billion dollars in revenue. The products include laser vision correction, contact lens care and cataract surgery technologies.
item.author: info@socaltech.com
item.itunes:author: socalTECH
item.itunes:subtitle: Frank Peters talks with Jim Mazzo, CEO of Advanced Medical Optics, for socalTECH

item.itunes:keywords: laser, contact lens, cataract surgery, ceo, optical, medical

item.title: Interview with Steve Iverson, Streamload
item.description: Our podcast interview today is with Steve Iverson, CEO and founder of San Diego-based Streamload (www.streamload.com). Steve talks about the company and gives some insight into the firm's new MediaMax service.
item.author: info@socaltech.com

item.itunes:subtitle: An interview with Steve Iverson, CEO and founder of San Diego-based file storage service Streamload.

item.title: Interview with Eric David Greenspan, MakeItWork
item.description: Our podcast today is with Eric David Greenspan, founder, Chairman, and CEO of MakeItWork, an angel-backed startup in Santa Barbara. Eric's company provides in-home computer support and other services. We spoke to Eric about his firm and growth.
item.author: info@socaltech.com

item.title: CODA Genomics
item.description: socalTECH Guest interview by Frank Peters, of the Frank Peters show. Frank Peters interviews Rick Lathrop and Wesley Hatfield, co-founders of CODA Genomics. CODA Genomics develops kits for the assembly of custom synthetic genes, used in the genomics industry.
item.author: info@socaltech.com
item.itunes:author: socalTECH
item.itunes:subtitle: Interview with Rick Lathrop and Wesley Hatfield

item.itunes:keywords: genomics, socaltech, genes, coda genomics, biotechnology, biotech, biology, venture capital, angel investment

item.title: Interview with Alex Bard, Goowy
item.description: My interview this morning is with Alex Bard, CEO of Goowy (www.goowy.com), a San Diego-based company in the Web 2.0 space. Goowy provides an online, virtual desktop and contact and calendar management applications. I spoke with Alex about the company, the application, and the firm's funding.
item.author: info@socaltech.com
item.itunes:author: socalTECH
item.itunes:subtitle: An interview with Alex Bard of Goowy.com, a Web 2 startup
